message.content:
cs.CR, cs.DC, cs.NI, cs.CY, cs.Distributed and Parallel Computing. 

Reasoning: 
1. cs.CR (Cryptography and Security) - The paper discusses the security flaws of existing micro-banking solutions and proposes a new payment scheme based on the Ethereum blockchain to address these issues. 
2. cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing) - The paper proposes a distributed system design that utilizes blockchain miners to handle regular transaction processing and saves on deployment and operational costs. 
3. cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture) - The paper discusses the challenges of accessing banking services in remote, rural regions with intermittent network connectivity and proposes a solution that takes advantage of the delay-tolerant nature of blockchains. 
4. cs.CY (Computers and Society) - The paper discusses the potential impact of the proposed payment scheme on remote communities that currently have limited access to banking services. 
5. cs.Distributed and Parallel Computing - The paper proposes a distributed system design that utilizes blockchain miners to handle regular transaction processing and saves on deployment and operational costs.
